title: "We are unable to log you on because you may be online"
body:
Was playing a SR game around 10mins ago when I had a massive lag spike, with my ping consistently sitting in the high 800s. After checking my network and finding no obvious reason for the lag spike (was only one on network, and traffic was normal) I decide to try and restart the router. Restarted router and PC, internet working fine (im on it now), tried to reconnect and get the above message ("We are unable to log you on because you may be online"). Now LOL is randomly patching some ~40mb patch.

This same thing happened on the weekend (lagged out during a game, couldn't get back on and then LOL started to patch), resulting in a leaver penalty which I just got rid of. My question is  - if I get another leaver penalty  due to this latest incident, I am able to have it removed as it was due to circumstances entirely outside of my control? (random server issue then patch)

replies.body:
update: I have been able to log back on after the mystery patch, no leavers penalty (yet). My ping is still ~800ms (in a practice tool game) with not reason for this on my end (still next to no traffic on network, am able to stream HD from youtube no problems).

update 2: d3 working fine so its not my connection

Hey there,

Could you please do the following for me;

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.
